metadata.title: CVE-2021-47521 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: can:sja1000: fix use after free in ems_pcmcia_add_card() If the last channel isnot available then "dev" is freed. Fortunately, we can just use "pdev->irq"instead. Also we should check if at least one channel was set up.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47521` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-generic - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-258-lowlatency - 4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1135.141
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1131-azure - 4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-258.292~14.04.2').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.141').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1131.144~14.04.1').
